Selection of Loop-Free Alternates for Multi-Homed Prefixes
Abstract
contents.ja: 抽象

contents.text: Deployment experience gained from implementing algorithms to determine Loop-Free Alternates (LFAs) for multi-homed prefixes (MHPs) has revealed some avenues for potential improvement. This document provides explicit inequalities that can be used to evaluate neighbors as potential alternates for MHPs. It also provides detailed criteria for evaluating potential alternates for external prefixes advertised by OSPF ASBRs. This document updates Section 6 of RFC 5286 by expanding some of the routing aspects.

contents.text: 1. Introduction
contents.ja: 1.はじめに

contents.text: A framework for the development of IP Fast Reroute (FRR) mechanisms is detailed in [RFC5714]. The use of LFAs for IP FRR is specified in [RFC5286]. If a prefix is advertised by more than one router, that prefix is called a "multi-homed prefix (MHP)". MHPs generally occur for prefixes obtained from outside the routing domain by multiple routers, for subnets on links where the subnet is announced from multiple ends of the link, and for prefixes advertised by multiple routers to provide resiliency.
contents.ja: IP高速再ルーティング（FRR）のメカニズムを開発するためのフレームワークは[RFC5714]に詳述されています。 IP FRRのためLFAsの使用は[RFC5286]で指定されています。プレフィックスは複数のルータによってアドバタイズされている場合は、そのプレフィックスは、「マルチホームプレフィックス（MHP）」と呼ばれています。たMHPは、一般にサブネットはリンクの複数の端部から、及び弾力性を提供するために、複数のルータによってアドバタイズされたプレフィクスのために発表されているリンクのサブネットのため、複数のルータによりルーティングドメイン外部から取得したプレフィクスのために起こります。

contents.text: Section 6.1 of [RFC5286] describes a method to determine LFAs for MHPs. This document describes a procedure using explicit inequalities that can be used by a computing router to evaluate a neighbor as a potential alternate for an MHP. The results obtained are equivalent to those obtained using the method described in Section 6.1 of [RFC5286].
contents.ja: [RFC5286]のセクション6.1のMHPのためLFAsを決定するための方法が記載されています。この文書では、MHPのための潜在的な代替として隣人を評価するために、コンピューティングルータで使用することができ、明示的な不平等を使用して手順を説明します。得られた結果は、[RFC5286]のセクション6.1に記載の方法を用いて得られたものと同等です。

contents.text: Section 6.3 of [RFC5286] discusses complications associated with computing LFAs for MHPs in OSPF. This document provides detailed criteria for evaluating potential alternates for external prefixes advertised by OSPF ASBRs, as well as explicit inequalities.

contents.text: This document also provides clarifications and additional considerations to [RFC5286] to address a few coverage and operational observations. These observations are concerned with 1) the IS-IS ATT (attach) bit in the Level 1 (L1) area, 2) links provisioned with MAX_METRIC (see Section 5.1) for traffic engineering (TE) purposes, and 3) multi-topology (MT) IGP deployments. These are elaborated in detail in Sections 3.2 and 5.

contents.text: 3.1. Improved Coverage with Simplified Approach to MHPs
contents.ja: 3.1。 MHPのように簡略化アプローチによる改善されたカバレッジ

contents.text: Section 6.1 of the LFA base specification [RFC5286] recommends that a router computes the alternate next hop for an IGP MHP by considering alternate paths via all routers that have announced that prefix. The same has been elaborated with appropriate inequalities in the previous section. However, Section 6.1 of [RFC5286] also allows for the router to simplify the MHP calculation by assuming that the MHP is solely attached to the router that was its pre-failure optimal point of attachment, at the expense of potentially lower coverage. If an implementation chooses to simplify the MHP calculation by assuming that the MHP is solely attached to the router that was its pre-failure optimal point of attachment, the procedure described in this memo can potentially improve coverage for ECMP MHPs without incurring extra computational cost.
contents.ja: LFAベース仕様[RFC5286]のセクション6.1は、ルータがプレフィックスと発表したすべてのルータを介して代替パスを考慮することによってIGP MHPの代替の次のホップを計算することをお勧めします。同じことは、前のセクションの適切な不平等で詳述されています。しかしながら、[RFC5286]のセクション6.1はまた、MHPは単に潜在的に低いカバレージを犠牲にし、アタッチメントのその前故障最適点であったルータに接続されていることを想定してMHPの計算を簡単にするルータを可能にします。実装は、MHPは、単にアタッチメントのその前故障最適点であったルータに接続され、このメモに記載された手順は、潜在的に余分な計算コストを招くことなくECMPのMHPのカバレッジを向上させることができると仮定してMHPの計算を簡略化することを選択した場合。

contents.text: Per [RFC1195], a default route needs to be added in the Level 1 (L1) router to the closest reachable Level 1 / Level 2 (L1/L2) router in the network advertising the ATT (attach) bit in its LSP-0 fragment. But, when multiple ECMP L1/L2 routers are reachable in an L1 area, corresponding best LFAs SHOULD be computed for each primary next hop associated with the default route as this would be similar to the ECMP MHP example described in Section 3.1. Considerations specified in Sections 3 and 3.1 are applicable for default routes if the default route is considered an ECMP MHP. If these procedures are strictly followed, there are situations, described below, where the only potential alternate available that satisfies the basic loop-free condition will not be considered as alternative. This document refers to the maximum link metric in IGPs as the MAX_METRIC. MAX_METRIC is called "maximum link metric" when defined for IS-IS in [RFC5305] and "MaxLinkMetric" when defined for OSPF in [RFC6987].

contents.text: 5.2. MT Considerations
contents.ja: 5.2。 MTの考慮事項

contents.text: Sections 6.2 and 6.3.2 of [RFC5286] state that multi-topology OSPF and IS-IS are out of scope for that specification. This memo clarifies and describes the applicability.
contents.ja: セクション6.2マルチトポロジーOSPFおよびIS-ISは、その仕様の範囲外であること[RFC5286]の状態6.3.2。このメモは、明確にし、適用性を説明しています。

contents.text: In multi-topology IGP deployments, for each MT-ID, a separate shortest path tree (SPT) is built with topology-specific adjacencies so the LFA principles laid out in [RFC5286] are actually applicable for MT IS-IS [RFC5120] LFA SPF. The primary difference in this case is identifying the eligible set of neighbors for each LFA computation; this is done per MT-ID. The eligible set for each MT-ID is determined by the presence of IGP adjacency from the source to the neighboring node on that MT-ID apart from the administrative restrictions and other checks laid out in [RFC5286]. The same is also applicable for MT-OSPF [RFC4915] or different AFs in multi-instance OSPFv3 [RFC5838].
contents.ja: [RFC5286]にレイアウトLFA原理はMTのために実際に適用されるように、マルチトポロジIGPの展開では、各MT-IDのために、別々の最短経路ツリー（SPT）は[RFC5120] LFA-ISトポロジー固有隣接して構築されていますSPF。この場合の主な違いは、それぞれLFA計算のために近隣の対象セットを識別しています。これは、MT-IDごとに行われます。各MT-IDの対象セットが離れ[RFC5286]にレイアウト行政制限及び他のチェックからのMT-IDで隣接ノードにソースからIGP隣接の存在によって決定されます。同じことがまた、MT-OSPF [RFC4915]またはマルチインスタンスのOSPFv3 [RFC5838]で異なるのAFに適用可能です。

contents.text: However, for MT IS-IS, if a "standard unicast topology" is used with MT-ID #0 [RFC5120] and both IPv4 [RFC5305] and IPv6 routes/AFs [RFC5308] are present, then the condition of network congruency is applicable for LFA computation as well. Network congruency here refers to having the same address families provisioned on all the links and all the nodes of the network with MT-ID #0. Here, with a single-decision process, both IPv4 and IPv6 next hops are computed for all the prefixes in the network. Similarly, with one LFA computation from all eligible neighbors per [RFC5286], all potential alternatives can be computed.

contents.text: 7. Security Considerations
contents.ja: 7.セキュリティの考慮事項

contents.text: The existing OSPF security considerations continue to apply, as do the recommended manual key management mechanisms specified in [RFC7474]. The existing security considerations for IS-IS also continue to apply, as specified in [RFC5304] and [RFC5310] and extended by [RFC7645] for Keying and Authentication for Routing Protocols (KARP). This document does not change any of the discussed protocol specifications (i.e., [RFC1195], [RFC5120], [RFC2328], and [RFC5838]); therefore, the security considerations of the LFA base specification [RFC5286] continue to apply.
